item.title: Portland R User Group: Aggregate making tables with gt package
item.description: Ted Landeras led this event for Portland R user Group where we watched Tich Lannone|| Making Beautiful Tables with {gt}|| RStudio as a group on Youtube, and then went through some other examples.

item.title: Tidy Spice
item.description: This post is my reproduction of Julia Silge’s blogpost Topic Modeling for #TidyTuesday Spice Girls Lyrics, with some added inspiration from a blogpost by Ariane Aumaitre called Tutorial: Text analysis and data visualization with Taylor Swift songs.

item.title: Midterm Prep. Group Theory
item.description: These notes are to help me prepare for MTH-344, Group Theory Applications midterm.

item.title: Midterm Prep. Modern College Geometry
item.description: Notes consists of logic, Euclid’s 5th, Congruence and Length Theorem, Congruence and Angle Theorem, angles and parallel lines, and triangle congruence theorems.

item.title: RStudio: Building a Blog with R
item.description: These are my notes from RStudio’s “Building a Blog with R” tutorial, which was presented by Isabella Velasquez on January 25th, 2022.

item.title: UO: ggplot2 p.2
item.description: These are my notes from the University of Oregon’s Data Service Consultants workshop on ggplot2, part 2.

item.title: Probability Distributions
item.description: Probability Distributions and equations. This post is under construction.

item.title: ggplot2 UO Workshop
item.description: These are my notes from the University of Oregon’s Data Service Consultants workshop on ggplot2.

item.title: LearnGeom
item.description: Code and plots using the LearnGeom package. For more information about LearnGeom, check out the package details here.

item.title: about
item.description: Hello Beautiful Person ❤️ My name is Randi Bolt (she/her/hers pronouns) and I am senior undergraduate at Portland State University, studying mathematics and statistics.
